description:
Niagara Falls Day, Evening & Private Tours From Toronto. Free Pickup & Drop Off At Your Hotel.
Let ToNiagara Tours take you on a Niagara adventure! We offer a variety of tours. Travelling from Toronto? Take our Toronto to Niagara Falls Group Bus Tour and see all the popular attractions on this 9.5 hour guided tour. We are dedicated to providing our customers with a unique tour experience.

reviews.title: Do not recommend
text: Uncorrect untrustable company, cant reach them, do not answer to emails, avoid them!!!!!! Pickup location is also a lye…

reviews.title: Unforgettable
text: Great to visit the Niagara Falls. It is possible to enter before the hour printed in your ticket. Be aware that you will receive a waterproof poncho because there is going to be water everywhere from the mist.

reviews.title: Activities were nice, but transportation wasn't
text: The activities were great (especially the Hornblower boat, which we really enjoyed), however, the transportation aspect left a lot to be desired. We received an email the day before explaining there would be only 2 pickups, however, there were actually 4 pickups that day all over town, including the airport. The trip there took over ~3.5 hours, when it would've been ~1.5 hours had we gone there ourselves. I thought the seating was really cramped and uncomfortable, more so than an economy flight. There was also no seating arrangement enforced, we were first to be picked up and sat on the first row (only fair, since we waited the longest), only to have it taken over by a couple who moved our stuff. Overall, I recommend going on your own, or choosing a tour with fixed stops.

reviews.title: Good trip to Niagara falls
text: Niagara Falls is amazing! The Boat Cruise was fab. However the ride was not so enjoyable as we were cramped sitting in the back seat of a car. The tour mentioned that it would be a small group in a SUV. I expected some more leg room. Our guide was Sasi and he took us to all the sightseeing places mentioned in the itinerary.

reviews.title: Amazing Experience
text: This was a wonderful tour in very comfortable transportation. Our guide Rocky was most amiable and showed us the best highlights of the area. I definitely recommend!

reviews.title: Highly recommend-made a busy day very enjoyable and relaxing!
text: We are so pleased we booked this tour to experience the amazing Niagara Falls. We booked the small group tour but were lucky enough for it to be only us, so got the private tour treatment in a very comfortable Tesla. Prior to the tour we had great communication from Nick about some specifics of the tour. Steve, our guide, was great and gave us a good balance of tour guide and to be left to our own devices. We had been considering hiring a car ourselves from Toronto but after witnessing the Toronto traffic we were so pleased to have Steve at the helm!

We highly recommend adding on the walk behind the falls and the dinner option at Skylon Tower, both amazing. At the end of our dinner Steve had the car waiting for us at the entrance ready to take us home. A full day and we thoroughly enjoyed it, and would highly recommend this tour.

reviews.title: Tour cancelled with delay in receiving refund; offered 2 tickets to compensate
text: Tour was cancelled by the company (a few days before the trip was due to occur in Dec 2022), it took 6 months and multiple follow ups but I have received my refund.  To compensate for the delay they offered 2 tickets for a day tour. We are unlikely to be able to use these as we do not live in Canada, however they have extended this offer to allow my son to use them who is on a working holiday in Canada.

reviews.title: A good start for a tourist
text: Had a wonderful time on the trip.  Time went by very quickly.  Didn't have as much time as I thought to try more things.  We started with a walk along the cliff edge facing the falls until we got to the Niagara cruises which led us down to the bottom of the cliff where we boarded a ship for a ~20 minute cruise into the waterfalls.  After which we were free to visit the entertainment district.  After we were picked up, we stopped at some of the nearby attractions leading to the wine tasting where we partook in 4 types of wine.

Not many signed up for the tour so I was picked up in a midsize SUV at my hotel in Oakville.  The tour operator was informative and sent out notices when they expected to arrive at my hotel on the morning of the tour.  A little brazen with their driving.

reviews.title: Ended up a great visit to the falls.
text: Ended up having a private driver to the falls as there was some mix up with picking us up at the hotel. So after some phone calls ended up getting a private driver later the same day.  Sam the driver was good. He had great knowledge.  The drive to the falls took much longer than expected but this was due to very heavy traffic so was pleased to be in a car and not on a bus.  Had lots of time to do the boat trip and look round Clifton street. Just needed to give Sam a call when we were ready to be picked up and he arrived in a few minutes. We then had a scenic tour round the area and back into Toronto. Ended up having a great day and lots of happy memories

reviews.title: Excellent
text: We booked with ToNiagara as they were the most cost affective but more importantly picked up from the hotel.

Our driver Nick was lovely. He was knowledgeable and a careful driver. We had a complimentary chocolate factory tour that didn't materialise as we were an hour early but we didn't mind missing that and went directly to Niagara.

This was a good move as it meant we had longer to walk around and have lunch. Our Hornblower boat tickets were included in the price too. We had a scenic drive along the lake. I would recommend stopping at Niagara Village as it looked very quaint. We'll do this again when we come back.
I would definitely recommend booking with ToNiagara

reviews.title: Niagara Tour
text: I totally enjoy the experience of seeing the Niagara Falls in its entirety closely, in the Hornblower ride....its a great, unforgettable experience and will gladly recommend to all my friends and family who have yet to visit Niagara .

reviews.title: Niagra
text: Excellent driver guide, Sam very cheerful. Tour was good only disappointment was the tour advert appeared to suggest that we would be going to Niagra on the Lake and not just drive through it without stopping. Everything was good lunch at The Sheraton was a worthwhile extra.

reviews.title: A great day out
text: A great way to see the falls. The guide was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Didn’t,t do the buffet as there’s plenty of places to eat locally. The wine tasting was fun and the trip to Niagara on the lake is lovely

reviews.title: Good tour, but is it worth the money?
text: Just like the name suggests, the ToNiagara tour is a great tour that takes you to the Niagara Falls. It includes your ticket entrance to the Hornblower cruise (the boat that takes you to the falls), a 10 min. stop at the Whirlpool Aero Car, a ten min. stop at the Floral Clock and a wine tasting. Just like in any other tour, you only have a limited time in each place. Once you get to the Niagara Parkway, they take you directly to the Hornblower. After the cruise they give you two hours of free time, barely enough to get lunch and take a quick walk through the area, where there is so much to do that you will be disappointed you don't have enough time to see it all. For the next stops you are only ten minutes in each, which I think that was enough, and the wine tasting is about 30 minutes. Please be advised, they say the wine tasting is included but it only includes the white and red wine tasting, if you want to try the ice wine (which you should because that's their specialty and its delicious!), they ask for a "donation" of 2 CAD for the white ice wine and 4 CAD for the red ice wine.

What I loved the most about the tour is that they pick you and drop you off at the hotel, which is the main reason why we chose this tour. The highlight of the tour is definitely the Falls/Hornblower cruise. I would have loved more free time on the Niagara falls area. Apart from the wine tasting, I would have rather skip the stops at the Whirlpool Aero Car and Floral Clock and just have more free time at the Falls.
Overall, I think is a good tour but a little overpriced.

reviews.title: Amazing experience
text: Relaxing beautiful tour. Amazing place and well organized trip. The group was exceptionally punctual and cooperative.

reviews.title: Perfect Solo trip
text: Enjoyed the trip as solo person and overall places visited , Niagara, worlds biggest whirlpool,smallest Chappel and biggest flower clock and wine tasting

reviews.title: Massy
text: Everything was wonderful , We also liked our leader(driver)
The location was wonderful.
Wine tasting was amazing.

reviews.title: Very good tour
text: We like it very much. The tour met our expectation. We shall recommend to others whenever they wish to go to Niagara from Torronto.

reviews.title: Fun Day Trip
text: An authentic taste of Niagara - the Falls and the region.
Traveling with my cousin who was experiencing Niagara Falls for the first time - so grateful for this option to showcase the beautiful Niagara Falls and region. Thanks!

reviews.title: Amazing Tour and Tourguide
text: Company is very communicative, late pick up because of traffic which is not the company mistake, but they always inform us minute by minute. The tour guide Jed (I guess a lady comes from India) is so amazing and think a lot of the guests condition. Always try to satisfy the guests and Can manage all the difficulties. 2 Thumbs up.
Wawi from Bali Indonesia.

reviews.title: Disappointing
text: We were collected from Starbucks outside the CN Tower as arranged and the pick up was on time. We did not have a tour guide only a nice lady driver who was as helpful as she could be given she did not have any support. The journey to Niagra was fine save for the hard breaking, tailgating and shocking suspension (or lack thereof) on the bus. Additionally, we could not hear the basic directions given as the speaker system is non existent. The worst part was the lack of air conditioning. We asked but were told that it took time to get the air con going. It eventually kicked in when my partner swapped seats so she was sat in the aisle around 5pm.

Back to the tour, Niagra is a must see. That goes without saying. The real selling point is Niagra. I can’t imagine people are booking this tour for the clock or some wine. The trip to Niagra was a whistle stop tour and only made up a minute fraction of our day. We had no time to take it in after the Hornblower. Off to lunch at the Sheraton we went. The views are spectacular and the food was pretty good. We had a small buffet with fish (very good), roast beef (very nice), chicken (bit dry), rice, steamed veg and various cold salads. Drinks were not included except for water, tea and coffee. Dessert was good too, more options than mains. We had about 50mins took great pictures and then dashed to the bus for our 1pm drive to the helicopter for those who opted in. Not sure where everyone else went.

We went on the helicopter which was fantastic. It provided incredible views and had a pre recorded in flight talk about the falls. The flight lasted 10mins or so. 6 passengers per flight. We were in a helicopter with four others and sat in the back. Two people get to sit up front. I would recommend trying to sit in the front if possible but the back seats provided good views too. The staff at the helipad took photos before the trip and just as I’ve now read from other reviewers, the photos are of the group of 6, which was not something we were interested in. They did take additional photos of each couple/group separately once sat in the helicopter. This was nice but $30CAD for a picture seems steep. I should add, they had 3 helicopters in rotation and so the wait was not too bad. Seemed like a well oiled machine.

Next up was the clock, floral clock to be exact. What an absolute waste of time. This added nothing to our excursion. We did not hear any information about how this related to... well, anything really. I should add that our tour was not narrated, and if it was, thanks to the sound system we wouldn’t have heard it. I’d like to think the driver/tour guide was focused on driving and so I would not begrudge her this considering she was on her own.

Next, off to the fruit and veg stall and small chapel that fits 6. Not sure it’s the smallest in the world, a quick google search suggests this may not be the case. The fruit and veg on offer was great. Not sure if it was organic etc but it tasted good and looked great. I thought it was overpriced but was happy to support local business. The chapel was essentially a shack. Cute but honestly I wouldn’t have missed it if we didn’t go there. Not sure it had much age or that it’s used, although it did have a power supply.

Finally on to the vineyard. I’ll keep this short. Two sips, one red, one white of the cheapest wine on offer. The “tour” was not a tour. In fact you have to pay $5 for an actual tour but of course we wouldn’t have had enough time. Our stops at each destination were roughly 10-25 mins (apart from the helicopter). You had to pay for a sip of the more expensive ice wine ($2 for white and $4 for red). The reason being that it takes 12 bottles to make the white and 20 to make the red. I should add that if you buy a bottle of ice wine then your $2/$4 is offset against the price of the bottle. We especially enjoyed that it was cooler in there than on our bus.

One final point, in case the tour operator reads this, we thought the little town of Niagra on the Lake was so very beautiful and quaint that we would have preferred a trip that split our time between the falls and that town where we could have gone through the lanes and stopped for some lunch away from the Vegas style strip in Niagra. The clock and vineyard are quite frankly forgettable.

reviews.title: Slightly disappointing
text: I took this trip yesterday with a friend of mine. The pick up arrived on time and then the tour headed to Niagara Falls. My main problem with this trip was the really poor quality coach that we travelled in. The suspension was completely gone so we were thrown around all over the place every time we hit a bump, which is often on the Toronto roads. It was extremely uncomfortable. After we went on the boat trip at the falls we had to rush to meet at the designated pick up point. It was a shame as the falls are the main reason people take this trip. We had to rush down lunch and didn’t really have time to do much gift shopping. We then carried on to look at various attractions such as the whirlpool, the floral clock and a small chapel. All of which were quite nice but took a lot of time. By the time we were back on the road to Toronto we hit rush hour which doubled the travel time back Toronto to 3 HOURS! As the coach was so old and poor quality it felt like an eternity. It was an awful trip back and a real downer on the whole day. ToNiagara need to invest in some decent vehicles and rethink their timings to avoid such a bad journey back. The tour guide was very nice nice although a little hard to understand at times.

reviews.title: Day trip to Niagara with wine tasting
text: This was a really good day, the falls were out of this world. Our tour guide collected us on time and we had also booked to buffet lunch. In addition to this we also booked tickets to go up the Skylon, we just about managed this as time was very tight at the falls but glad we did this. The only downer on the day was the minibus as it was a pretty uncomfortable drive, we felt every bump and dip in the road. The suspension on the bus was very poor.

reviews.title: Avoid
text: There were a number of issues with the "tour". I'll focus on one that was particularly disturbing to me. The driver of our vehicle spent more time looking at and chatting with the tour guide in the passenger seat than she did keeping her eyes on the road while driving. I don't think I need to emphasize how insanely dangerous it is to have a bus traveling at 120kmh with a driver paying very little attention to the road. Sort out your drivers before they kill passengers and other motorists, ToNiagara.

reviews.title: Worst Tour Operator Ever!
text: We were the last ones to be picked up by the mini bus and I had to sit separately with my husband. Sitting next to a stranger on a bus is not exactly what I had in mind for the tour. Instead of enjoying the ride with my husband, I had to endure 2 quiet hours sitting next to a stranger. It’s a small group, the tour guide could have at least arranged for seats to avoid such awkward experience.
The boat tour to Niagara itself was good.

Lunch was horrible! Food sucks. Plus I requested to be seated at a different table for just me and my husband and the lady said it couldn’t be done. Why do I need to seat with another couple we didn’t know?! Seriously awkward lunch. Ugh. I can’t believer I paid $400 CAD for this.
The driver kept on looking and chatting with the tour guide too instead of paying attention on the road.
Avoid this tour. There are other tour operators that will be worth your money.

reviews.title: Overpriced, itinery and alternatives not as advertised - avoid this one
text: Almost an hour touring downtown Toronto to pick up other trippers who could not be bothered to arrive on time. Boring journey to Niagara where we told the first item was the highlight of the day - a ride on Hornblower into the Falls. Only after leaving the coach were we told that the boats were cancelled because of too much water. Despite the advertised alternatives to be offered if the boat was not working ( Sky tower or walk behind the falls) we were simply given boat tickets and told to take our luck in the queue in case they started the boat trips.

We walked and photographed and checked with Hornblowers at midday to be told the first boat would not be until the afternoon. Having booked and paid for an overpriced buffet at the Sheraton at 1-00pm we cut our losses and went to Lunch. Best part was the view from the restaurant - the buffet was like a cattle truck feeding time.

Having been told the stay in Niagara was extended for an hour to give trippers the best chance for a boat ride we returned to the coach at the instructed time of 2-00pm only to wait for another 25 minutes for 2 ignorant trippers who decided to get on the now operating boat even though they were out of time. No consideration for others sitting in a coach waiting in well over 30 degrees.

The afternoon tour was greatly reduced - 10 minutes to see a whirlpool, 10 minutes to see the 'worlds largest flower clock" - it is not the largest, 5 minutes fast and no colour. The anticipated hour and a half in Niagara On the Lake which we really looked forward to, was cancelled completely. A wine tasting visit was a total waste of time. 1 sip of the cheapest white, one sip of the cheapest red and a load of waffle from a salesman about how to hold a wine glass. Being a vine yard owner we left in disgust.

Then a stop for 15 minutes to fill up the coach with petrol (surely this could have been done during the drivers waiting time in Niagara) before hitting the Expressway again and the traffic jams back into Toronto. Best part of the day was that we were first to get off the coach

reviews.title: dissapointing
text: Firstly, the Falls are really impressive and well worth the visit.

The pick-up was on time as we were the frist but then we spent an hour going round down-town Toronto picking up others through the traffic. What was suposed to be a shuttle bus to then transfer to a coach turned out to be the "coach" and was so noisy we couldnt hear the narration, even though we were on the second row seats. The air con did not work effectively, which was a real issue in the afternoon as temps hit 30 degrees. By the time we arrived back at the htoel, we were exhausted and nauseous.
The "add-ons" such a whirl pool (impressive), flral clock (less so) and small chapel (really?) had only 10 minutes to appreciate without any guidance as was clearly on offer for other tour companies.
Finally the wine tasting. Good narration from thw vineyard staff but to sample the icewine, the main feature, wasnt free, rather $2 was requested for a sip!
Overall, I think this coudl have been a more professional tour and would warn fellow travellers to look at other tours before considering.

reviews.title: Niagra Falls Day Tour from Toronto including Lunhc and boat trip plus wine tasting
text: The tour started on time. 2nd July 19. Airport pickup and drop off offered which was very difficult to get in other tour companies as it helped me out a lot as I had next day early morning flight to New York. 2 ladies were managing the trip., one the driver and other as tour narrate helper and both were very cooperative and helpful and smiling faces. Forgot to ask their names. The trip was well sorted out with minute details being taken care off. Overall a learning and pleaser experience with every help one thinks of was provided including where in Toronto and Missisaga, the places to eat, nearby transport etc.
Regards,
Amir Kamal
Australia

reviews.title: Amazing company. I hope they train drivers really well :-)
text: I know I am late to review as we used this company last year! We booked a tour for our family, 6 of us. We loved visiting the Falls (and skipping the ticket queue!) and Niagara on the Lake was stunning. The trip to the vineyard was a lot of fun and we learned a lot on the trip. I tailored the trip over email and Nick K was super helpful and awesome in accommodating what we wanted to see. It was so convenient to be picked up and dropped off at the hotel. We got to see lots and explore the amazing places that Ontario has to offer.

One thing- our driver was absolutely lovely when he picked us up. He was chatty, full of knowledge and helpful- we had a good laugh with him all day. But on the way back to Toronto, in the last 2 hours of driving, he took a phonecall (while we were driving on the highway back which was a bit scary) and sometime upset him as he was having a very angry conversation, raised voice etc. After that his mood soured. At one point, while driving at speed, he rolled down the window and spat his gum out and asked us moody and odd questions like "so did you drink a lot at the vineyard then?" Which we didn't at all given we were with our teenagers and are a boring old family. He seemed very unhappy and we were trying to be upbeat by asking about some of the things we passed and he just shrugged. Eventually he just sat in silence (turned the radio off too). It was awkward...! Hours later when we got back (bad traffic), he dropped us off in relative silence and muttered bye and sped off. We stood outside the hotel looking at each other and all said 'what was that about?!" It was surreal how he went from the most sweet, helpful guide to being really unhappy- it wasn't us, we are nice!
This did not impact on our lovely day as a family but it was kinda strange. To be honest, we were having such a nice holiday that I didn't complain to the company and didn't feel the need to anyway.
I think this company is awesome. I hope they are providing good training to the guides/ drivers and are truly focused on customer service and that is my only recommendation.
I would recommend them to anyone as we did have a lovely day (except the last 2 hours) and the communication we had before was super helpful. :-)

reviews.title: Niagra Falls Tour
text: Coach arrived on time, driver Sam and guide Sue were both friendly. It's an hour and a half from Toronto to the falls so we did have one convenience stop. Sue gave us some highlights of the trip and provided us with a verbal itinerary including what to expect. Boat tour was most fun! Buffet lunch at Sheraton was fine but the real star was the view overlooking the falls - beautiful!
Other stops included the smallest chapel, the flower clock, the whirlpool and a winery for a tasting experience. All were fun!
The trip back was longer than usual because of a freeway closure but all worked out. Thank you for a fun experience during our first trip to Toronto and the falls!

reviews.title: Fun experience
text: We decided on the trip in the afternoon and evening.  It made for a long day, leaving around 2pm, back close to midnight, but worth it for probably the only time we will visit the falls.  We enjoyed the falls at day and then at night.  Fireworks only lasted 5 minutes, but still a fun experience.  Our driver was nice, but looked at his cell phone far too much and for silly reasons like looking at photos.  Not safe or appropriate but still worth 4 stars.

reviews.title: ToNiagara tour
text: The trip was highly overpriced. They promised four stops before The Niagara falls, but we got two: a very poor winetasting and a nice small chappel. The falls were awesome, but I'm sure there's a much cheaper way to get there.

reviews.title: Meh—Shaken not stored shuttle van
text: Our guide, Jeet, was a bit hard to understand but she did repeat everything twice which was amusing. She had a lot of facts that she stated so it was a bit like being read to from a book. She was very sweet. It was nice to be picked up/dropped off right at our hotel.

My only really complaint was the shuttle bus. I realize the roads at times were not of the best condition but the bus needs new shocks, I don’t know if the bus even had shocks and felt like I’d been on a longer than desired jackhammer job. There was also horrible whistling through the windows. The company needs to consider that we paid over $200 per person and the ride should be much more comfortable. I can’t imagine being elderly!

It was nice to have someone else drive us, we were able to sit back and enjoy the beautiful fall leaves and the other pretty sights. The winery was great, too short of a visit to look around but the wine sommelier was good and entertaining.
The first stop before the falls took us to an absolutely stunning vista where cable cars traveled over the water. Again, the fall colors were exquisite.

Once at the falls, we had about four hours to go on boat ride, then look around while then finding dinner. I was surprised at the activity in the town, a bit more carnival atmosphere than I’d ever imagined while contrasting with the beauty and awe of the falls. I suppose that’s to keep the kids entertained. The Ferris wheel was a beautiful sight, it lasted much longer than we expected.
In closing, I’d do the tour again but I’d request a newer or upgraded vehicle.

reviews.title: ToNiagra tour.
text: My wife and I have just been on a Niagara Tour and enjoyed it immensely. The falls were spectacular.

The arrangements made through Nick in the office were very smooth.  The transport was comfortable and arrived promptly. The weather on the day was poor so the driver (Sam) adjusted our schedule so that we weren’t hanging about in the cold and rain. We were shown additional view points, the rapids, smallest church, Niagara on the Lake and enjoyed the wine tasting. Sam was very informative and a helpful, friendly guide.
All in all, a great trip. Thank you Go Niagara.

reviews.title: A long day............
text: I booked this tour because they offered airport hotel pick-up and I booked online about 4 days before the day of the trip. Pre-trip email communication was very good and we were picked up by the bus as arranged at our hotel in Airport Drive, Mississagua at about 07.30. After another airport hotel pick-up, we were then taken back to Toronto, in the rush-hour, to make 2 further pick-ups. A further stop was made on the way to Niagara, at Mississagua, about 09:45 and we reached Niagara Falls at about 11:15. (We'd been in the bus for nearly 4 hours already!)

First up was the Hornblower boat ride, which was excellent,  It was well organised and quite exciting to be taken close up to the Horseshoe falls.  There was time then to get some lunch and have a walk along the well-maintained gardens towards the Horseshoe Falls. At 2 pm, we left Niagara Falls, in the bus, for short visits to the Whirlpool, the Floral Clock and the so-called World's smallest Chapel.  These were 10 minute stops which was just about enough tbh.
The last stop was at a winery, which I quite enjoyed, and we got to taste some local wine and, at a small charge, some ice-wine - nice!

We left the winery, in the bus, just after 4 pm and drove at speed back towards Toronto and made the first drop-off in Mississagua at about 5:30pm. This was about 15mins from the airport hotels where we'd started, but instead of going to the airport to drop us, we then had to endure another 2 hour rush-hour trip into Toronto and then back to the airport, finally dropping-off us and the other airport group at about 7.15pm, nearly 12 hours after being picked up.
The driver/guide, Steve, was friendly enough and fond of the hyperbole, but I couldn't understand why we couldn't have been dropped off at the airport on the way back before going into Toronto.
I'm only saying all this to suggest that if you're at the airport, then check on the pick-up/drop-off schedule, as you may find yourself spending hours on the bus.

Lastly, and I'm not making any connections, but I put my credit card details into the online booking system (the only time I ordered online on our Canada trip) and a couple of days later, my card details were used for an (attempted) fraudulent transaction.

reviews.title: Dysfunctional vehicle with spoilt A/C, extreremly poor service recovery
text: I booked a trip on 2nd Sept.
Everything started well with the pick up at our hotel location. Communication was smooth between their staff (Nick) and myself over email on the details prior to this. So far so good.

Alas, that was when problems started to surface. After all passengers were picked up, we headed for Niagara. The A/C in the bus stopped working completely. It started to get extremely warm, stuffy and uncomfortable. Mind you, the windows in the bus cannot be opened. There is no ventilation, fan or wind. The A/C in the driver's seat was still functional. For the rest of us in the bus, it was the beginning of a long, uncomfortable and painful trip.

No one flagged this issue because we thought the driver turned off the A/C. After 4 hours of our own time at Niagara, it was time to head back. The A/C remained spoilt, and that is when I realised it was going to remain that way. I emailed customer support to ask for something to be done. They could not open the windows because the glass windows were not built to be opened (only for air conditioning). Someone said they will send a mechanic ( did not see one). It felt so great to finally arrive at our destination, because the bus was a real torture to be in.

I emailed customer support to ask for some form of compensation at the end of the trip. I believe it is fair to refund customers something for a service they could not deliver. After a lengthy wait (6 working days), I received a email saying a damaged A/C is not liable for any form of refund. I only requested a portion of compensation out of goodwill, not the entire fee paid. Because I paid for a proper service and they could not deliver it and thought that was fair to get something back.

Sometimes, accidents happen beyond's one control. It is the service recovery that comes into play and it it fell way flat here. We only received apologies from the driver and the correspondent in the email, but it felt like it was just lip service. Words are cheap, but my money isn't.
Do not trust the reviews on their website. It only had 5 star reviews which was rather misleading. That is why I am sharing my experiences here.

It is unfortunate because on another day, the A/C would have worked fine and this would be a decent tour. Just hope you get lucky that the A/C works and you get your money's worth, because I'm still charging you in full even though I messed up. That's the opinion I get from this company. To conclude, spend your money elsewhere.

reviews.title: Fun Trip!
text: Love our tour guide! We were on schedule at every stop listed on the itinerary. The boat tour was fun and the winery was delicious! Definitely recommend this tour to people who want to experience Niagara Falls!

reviews.title: Great trip, crazy driver
text: We booked the nighttime falls trip with the wine tasting tour. Expected to be on a coach, but ended up being picked up at our hotel in a private SUV (Excursion) driven by Ken. Enthusiastic tour guide, gave us lots of information on the way down, allowed us to pick and choose if we wanted to stop at various attractions. Went on the Aero Car, did the wine tasting, and got great directions for the Hornblower and dinner at the Sheraton. The drive back in the dark scared my wife. At times he was doing 140 kph on the highway.

reviews.title: Visit Niagara Falls by yourself would be better
text: Good:
-transport from central location
-tickets to hornblower included hence no need to queue for it
-winery wine tasting had good wine
Bad:
-not enough time for lunch and exploring around the very exciting look Clifton Street
-floral clock & chapel was uninteresting and unnecessary
-merely drove by niagara on the lake
-accent of guide was rather hard to understand. And she had to drive and talk at the same time. Would rather there be a dedicated guide
-winery tour didnt actually tour anything

Would like to make a comment on the pick up and drop off system. We had some guests being picked up out of town, on the way to Niagara Falls, after picking us up from Toronto City. But based on the company's first-to-pick-first-to-drop system, these guests ended up making a big detour into the rush hour of Toronto City before being dropped back out of town. It would make more sense to drop them first then go into the city. Think the company needs to be more flexible about this.

reviews.title: Excellent Trip
text: Some places were not shown and that is the reason for rating. Otherwise the trip started well on time and we had good visit to Niagara. Again some confusion before boarding the Niagara boat ride as we were not given the ticket but that was sorted by the tour attender in few minutes time.
